description: This South Oxfordshire based village is located on the River Thames near Streatley and Wallingford. The pictureque stretch of the Thames around Moulsford has strong literary connections, featuring in The Wind in the Willows and Jerome K Jerome's Three Men in a Boat. This circular walk from the village takes you along both sides of the Thames visiting the neighbouring settlements of North Stoke, South Stoke, Streatley and Goring. The route makes use of The Ridgeway and Thames Path National Trails. Just north of Moulsford you'll also pass through Cholsey Marsh where you can look out for a wide variety of wildlife including crested grebe, warblers and a colony of the nationally rare Desmoulin's whorl snail. It's a particularly lovely section of the River Thames with weirs, old bridges and wonderful views of the surrounding Chilterns countryside.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: After your walk you can enjoy some well earned refreshments at the Beetle and Wedge pub. The 19th century pub is positioned in a lovely spot right next to the river with an outdoor seating area commanding fine views across the water. They serve good quality dishes and have a restaurant area with a classic and modern British menu. In 2005 the restaurant played host to Griff Rhys Jones, Dara Ó Briain and Rory McGrath, and a dog called Loli, during the filming of Three Men in a Boat – a film broadcast and commissioned by the BBC as a modern-day reinterpretation of the travelogue by Jerome K Jerome. You can find them at postcode OX10 9JF for your sat navs. They are dog friendly and also provide car parking.
